clinical_study.brief_title: Prophylactic Trimethoprim/Sulfamethoxazole to Prevent Severe Infections in Patients With Lupus Erythematous
clinical_study.official_title: Prophylactic Trimethoprim-Sulfamethoxazole for the Prevention of Serious Infections in Patients With Systemic Lupus Erythematosus: a Randomized Placebo Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole is effective in preventing serious infectious complications (those that require hospitalization or lead to death) in patients with lupus erythematosus that receive intermediate or high dose steroids.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Infections that lead to hospitalization for >24 hours or lead to death.

secondary_outcome.description: A serious adverse event is an adverse event that leads to death, persistent disability, leads to hospitalization or increase in length of hospitalization. Additionally, an adverse event that does not immediately put life at risk, but that requires a medical or surgical intervention to prevent a serious adverse event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first episode of non-viral severe infection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 weeks after randomization until the date of the first episode of a non-viral severe infection, up to 1 year after randomization.
secondary_outcome.description: Infections that lead to hospitalization for >24 hours or lead to death, that are not of viral etiology.
Death or hospitalization due to any cause infectious or non-infectious

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients that develop infections resistant to TMP-SMX
secondary_outcome.description: Infections that would traditionally be considered susceptible to TMP-SMX
Number of patients that require drug discontinuation due to safety concerns

arm_group.description: Trimethoprim-Sulfamethoxazole 180mg/800mg oral tablet, 3 times a week, for 6 months. Subjects may remain on the drug longer (maximum 1 year), if they continue to receive intermediate or high dose steroids at the end of 6 months.

Tablets that look exactly the same as the experimental drug, 3 times a week, for 6 months. Subjects may remain on the placebo longer (maximum 1 year), if they continue to receive intermediate or high dose steroids at the end of 6 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Systemic Lupus Erythematosus according to the American College of Rheumatology Criteria
- On a daily dose of corticosteroid of ≥ 0.5 mg/kg/d, and that are expected to remain on the this dose for at least 1 month.
- Have signed an informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Absolute contraindication to receive TMP-SMX (known allergy to TMP-SMX or sulfa drugs; TMP-SMX induced thrombocytopenia)
- Received TMP-SMX treatment in the previous month
- The presence of concomitant rheumatologic autoimmune disease with the exception of antiphospholipid syndrome
- Creatinine clearance <30ml/min/m2
- Chronic viral infection (Hepatitis C virus, Hepatitis B virus, Human immunodeficiency virus)
- Malignant neoplasm, except for skin neoplasm
- Primary immune deficiencies
- Solid organ or hematopoietic stem cell transplant recipients
- Pregnancy or Breastfeeding
- Current active infection or in the 2 weeks prior.
- Absolute Neutrophil Count < 750/mm3, platelets <30x10^9/L, o hemoglobin <8 g/dL
- Patients receiving Methotrexate
- Patients participating in another research study that to the judgement of the principal investigator could jeopardize the safety or efficacy of the study drug.
